question_sentence: The FDA asked manufacturers and restaurants to reduce their use of what ingredient in an effort to reduce Americans’ intake of it by 12%?
William Shatner joined Blue Origin’s spaceflight on Wednesday. How long did the trip last?
Which band removed a 1970s hit song from its setlist over lyrics depicting slavery?
A National Institutes of Health study found that the best booster for the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine is:
Southwest Airlines, which recently canceled up to 30% of flights, is secretly doling out what to travelers in addition to refunds or credits?
Which of these DC Comics heroes will come out as bisexual in an upcoming story?
A record-breaking number of Americans left their jobs in August, according to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics. How many quit their job?
Matt Amodio’s run on “Jeopardy!” came to an end Monday, with his winnings totaling $1,518,601. How many consecutive games did he win?
American bumblebees have essentially disappeared in all these states except:
The Los Angeles Dodgers made a surprising move to scratch Julio Urias from his Game 5 start versus the San Francisco Giants, replacing him with:
Former health secretary Matt Hancock has accepted a new job with which international organisation?
evidence: Hancock’s official job title will be ‘UN special representative on financial innovation and climate change for the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa’.

question_sentence: Former Little Mix singer Jesy Nelson has been at the centre of a social media storm after being accused of doing what in her latest music video?
evidence: Nelson, who identifies as white British, is seen with darkened skin, braided hair and grills on her teeth in the video for Boyz, which samples P Diddy’s song Bad Boy for Life.

question_sentence: The partially shredded Banksy artwork formerly known as Girl with Balloon sold at Sotheby’s this week for more than £18m - well above the guide price of how much?
evidence: The artwork was renamed Love Is In The Bin after being partially destroyed by a shredder hidden in the frame moments after selling at auction for more than £1m in 2018.

question_sentence: A New York Times investigation has uncovered a pandemic-related security crisis at New York’s Rikers Island prison, where the annual cost of jailing each inmate is how much?
evidence: The US paper reported that inmates have taken over the jail amid major staffing shortages triggered by the Covid crisis. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: A US navy engineer and his wife are facing espionage charges after allegedly trying to sell a digital memory card containing nuclear secrets that was hidden in what?
evidence: Jonathan Toebbe, who had top-secret security clearance, was arrested alongside his wife in West Virginia after trying to sell restricted data about submarine nuclear reactors to an undercover FBI agent posing as a foreign official.

question_sentence: Boris Johnson has resolved a row between Liz Truss and Dominic Raab by telling them to share which grace-and-favour country mansion?
evidence: Chevening House is ‘traditionally used by the foreign secretary’, said The Times, but Raab apparently objected to losing access to the Kent estate after being replaced by Truss in last month’s cabinet reshuffle.

question_sentence: Which bestselling author has been under attack for refusing to sell the translation rights to their new novel to an Israeli-based publishing house?
evidence: Rooney said her decision not to sell the Hebrew translation rights to her book Beautiful World, Where Are You to a publisher in Israel was based on the country’s ‘system of racial domination’ and her support for Palestinian causes.

question_sentence: Where was the Queen caught criticising world leaders who ‘talk’ about tackling the climate crisis but ‘don’t do’?
evidence: The Queen was overheard telling the Duchess of Cornwall and the Senedd's presiding officer Elin Jones that ‘I’ve been hearing all about’ the upcoming Cop26 climate summit in Glasgow but ‘still don’t know who is coming’.

question_sentence: At which popular tourist destination was Boris Johnson on holiday this week?
evidence: The prime minister was criticised for relaxing in Marbs at a luxury villa owned by fellow Tory Zac Goldsmith while ministers back home scrambled to tackle the energy crisis.

question_sentence: BBC presenter Jeremy Vine tweeted that he was ‘unnerved’ after his family home was targeted by which group of protesters?
evidence: The anti-vaccination campaigners were filmed at Vine's west London home demanding that his wife accept a ‘notice of liability’ about the Covid jab.

question_sentence: US officials said that diplomatic talks with foreign officials this week were “candid and professional.” Who were these talks with?
evidence: US officials met with representatives of the Taliban in Doha, Qatar, the first such meeting since the United States’ withdrawal from Afghanistan.

question_sentence: According to a recent report, approximately how much of the United States’ critical infrastructure is at risk of failure due to flooding?
evidence: The First Street Foundation, a nonprofit research and technology group, published a report saying that 25% of critical infrastructure in the US is at substantial risk of failure due to flooding. This includes police and fire stations, hospitals, airports and wastewater treatment facilities.

question_sentence: Citing a range of reasons, which low-cost airline canceled more than 2,000 of its flights last weekend?
evidence: Southwest Airlines, the world’s largest low-cost carrier, canceled more than 2,000 flights, blaming everything from air traffic control problems to limited staffing in Florida.

question_sentence: The NFL made its way back to London’s Tottenham Hotspur Stadium for the first time in two years, with the Atlanta Falcons emerging victorious. Which team did the Falcons beat?
evidence: The Atlanta Falcons bested the New York Jets 27-20, making it the first NFL game to be held in London since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic.

question_sentence: The ruins of an ancient Byzantine factory – the largest of its kind ever discovered – were unveiled in Israel following a two-year excavation. What did the factory produce?
evidence: The 1,500-year-old-complex, located in the Israeli town of Yavne, was home to the largest Byzantine wine factory ever found, with evidence suggesting it produced wine in large, commercial quantities — up to two million liters every year.

question_sentence: Deadly clashes and gunfire erupted as demonstrators took to the streets to protest a judge overseeing a high-profile, high-stakes investigation in their country. Where did this happen?
evidence: The protests and subsequent violence took place in Beirut, Lebanon, as supporters of Iran-backed Hezbollah and its main Shia ally, Amal, called for the ouster of a popular judge overseeing an investigation into the massive explosion at Beirut’s port in August 2020 that killed more than 200 people and injured thousands more.

question_sentence: What Netflix series did the streaming service deem its “biggest-ever series at launch?”
evidence: Netflix said the Korean hit “Squid Game” has become its most-watched series at launch, viewed by more than 111 million accounts since its debut in mid-September. It even reached No. 1 status in the US – the first Korean series ever to top Netflix’s US rankings.

question_sentence: Beatles legend Paul McCartney referred to a famed musical group as simply a “blues cover band.” What band was he referring to?
evidence: In keeping up a friendly rivalry and in promoting a new book, McCartney referred to the Rolling Stones as a “blues cover band” during an interview recently published in The New Yorker.

question_sentence: What is the Transportation Security Administration reportedly confiscating in record numbers at airport security checkpoints?
evidence: The TSA has seen a major uptick in the confiscation of guns at US-based airport checkpoints. The agency said its screeners have caught 4,650 firearms so far year – the most ever recorded in a calendar year.

question_sentence: Butterball issued a recall on more than 14,000 pounds of ground turkey after consumers reported finding bits of what specific item in the meat?
evidence: Consumers reported finding blue plastic pieces embedded in their raw ground turkey, a discovery which led to the massive recall.
